intro: Vaccinium ceramense, commonly known as the Ceram heath, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the island of Ceram in Indonesia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many acid-loving plants such as blueberries and cranberries. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and is often found in forest understories or on rocky slopes. Its small, bell-shaped flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces dark blue or black berries that are edible. This plant plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food for local wildlife and contributing to forest biodiversity.
